entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 4:15PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Altimeter Settings Could Exceed 31 Inches... Very strong high pressure building along the ALCAN Border tonight, combined with very cold temperatures, could cause altimeter settings to rise above 31.00 inches tonight and Tuesday over the Yukon Flats, and along the Yukon Valley upstream to Eagle and along the Porcupine River. Altimeter settings above 31.00 inches

entry.title: Local Area Emergency issued January 04 at 8:12AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE KANAWHA METRO. METRO 911 HAS RECEIVED MULTIPLE REPORTS OF HAZARDOUS DRIVING CONDITIONS DUE TO BLACK ICE. MOTORISTS ARE ADVISED TO USE EXTREME CAUTION, ESPECIALLY ON INTERSTATES, OVERPASSES, AND BRIDGES.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 7:18AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Icy Patches this Morning... Cold temperatures and water from melted snow will result in patchy ice on area roads this morning. This will be especially problematic on untreated roadways. Motorists should exercise extra caution, and assume that any surfaces which look wet or slushy may in fact be icy.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Pendleton; Hardy; Jefferson; Western Pendleton
